intro: Delphinium mairei, commonly known as the Maire delphinium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, bearing large, showy blue to purple flowers arranged in dense spikes. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are deeply lobed, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for alpine gardens. Delphinium mairei is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine.
